properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. ### Proceed with caution as visibility may suddenly be reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-08-19T23:37:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T07:37:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3751876444.2019
Area: Lake Saint-Jean, Lake Memphrémagog - northern half
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times is expected. Heavy rain and strong winds today and tonight over Arviat ending Tuesday. A slow moving low pressure system over Hudson Bay will continue to bring heavy rain and strong northeast winds to southern Kivalliq. At 5:00 am this morning 18 mm of rain had already fallen overnight. Total rainfall amounts will range between 30-50 mm by Tuesday morning before the rainfall starts to taper off. Northeasterly winds, gusting at times to 80 km/h, will moderate slightly this afternoon and continue to moderate tonight into Tuesday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-20T02:17:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T10:18:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0642459761.2019
Area: Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts over bodies of water. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-19T20:39:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T08:40:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2241023288.2019
Area: Louiseville area, Matawin - Mauricie National Park area, Lac-aux-Sables area, Shawinigan area, Sainte-Anne-de-la-Pérade area, Trois-Rivières area, Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area, Ashuapmushuan Wildlife Reserve area, Normandin - Péribonka area, Alma - Desbiens area, Saint-Félicien - Roberval area, Lake Bouchette area, La Tuque area, Falardeau - Mont-Valin area, Sainte-Rose-du-Nord area, Ville de Saguenay area, Rivière-Éternité - Petit-Saguenay area, Tadoussac - Baie-Sainte-Catherine area, La Malbaie area, Baie-Saint-Paul area, Apica Mountain area, Grands-Jardins Park area, l'Étape area, Bécancour - Villeroy area, Victoriaville area, Nicolet area, Drummondville area, Granby - Waterloo area, Brome-Missisquoi area, Richmond area, Weedon area, Thetford Mines area, Mont-Orford - Lake Memphrémagog area, Sherbrooke area, Coaticook area, Lac-Mégantic area, Cookshire area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow will ease this morning as a low pressure system over northern BC dissipates. Further snowfall accumulations of up to 4 cm are expected at higher elevations between Fort Nelson and Watson Lake. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Heavy snowfall accumulation may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-19T20:34:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T11:30:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0966033183.2019
Area: Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada
